title: AP Computer Science A - Practice Quiz

questions.text: 1. What is the role of a compiler in programming?

options.A: To execute the program line by line
options.B: To translate source code into machine code

questions.text: 2. Which of the following is a primitive data type in Java?
3. What is the correct way to declare a variable that can store a decimal number?
4. Which operator is used to assign a value to a variable?
5. What does the term "casting" refer to in Java?

options.B: Converting a value from one type to another

questions.text: 6. What is the output of the expression 5 + 3 * 2 in Java?
7. Which of the following is a valid compound assignment operator?
8. What is the purpose of an algorithm?

options.A: To create a graphical user interface
options.B: To outline steps to solve a problem

questions.text: 9. Which statement correctly reads an integer input from the user using Scanner?
10. What does it mean if a Java program will not compile?

options.A: It runs successfully but produces wrong output
options.B: It contains syntax errors preventing translation to bytecode
options.D: It takes too long to execute

options.B: Type mismatch: cannot convert String to int

options.C: Cannot assign double to int without casting

questions.text:
18. Identify the error:
System.out.println("Hello World)

options.A: nextLine() returns a String, not int

questions.text: 1. Write a Java code block that declares an integer variable named score, assigns it the value 85, then prints "Your score is: " followed by the value of score.
questions.canonical:
int score = 85;
System.out.println("Your score is: " + score);

questions.text: 2. Given two variables a and b of type double, write code to calculate their average and store it in a variable named avg. Then print the value of avg.
3. Write code that reads an integer input from the user using a Scanner object named input, then decreases the value by 10 using a compound assignment operator, and finally prints the new value.
